p: “Regardless of its causes, it may be common that susceptibility to infectious disease has a simple genetic basis. […] In these studies the polymorphism with the largest effect was found against the only natural D. melanogaster pathogen tested (a polymorphism in Diptericin detected using Providencia rettgeri infection), anecdotally supporting the patterns seen here [Unckless, Rottschaefer and Lazzaro, 2015].”
